data: If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps forward. Take 9 steps right. Take 10 steps backward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If you always face forward all directions you would take 9 steps right, 10 steps forward, and 10 backward. So, the answer is yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If you turned around you would be back where you started. So, the answer is yes.

The first 6 steps to get to the where you should start could only be made on a tarmac, so you are only going to the starting point if you follow these instructions. So, the answer is yes.

Whenever you retrace your steps it is always from the same spot. When you make a move forward, the previous one is the one you begin with. So, the answer is yes.

Take 2 steps forward then take 3 steps forward. The first step backward is always facing forward always facing away from the beginning. The second step backward is always facing away from the beginning always facing inward. So, the answer is No.

While facing one's back, you usually first facing towards you. The first step backward turns to forward when you take that step. The second step backward turns to rear when you take that step. So, the answer is yes.

Steps forward always return to the starting point. Thus, the answer is yes.

The direction of travel is always up and the direction of the head. Forward motion focuses on the direct path forward. Forward motion focuses on the direction in which the body is moving. So, the answer is Yes.

If you keep facing forward, you are never going backwards. If you only return to where you started, you are going to start from where you started. So, the answer is No.

No it doesn’ t you still have to go backward, as you already took the first step. You have to take another step and then take another step backward to get from where you started. So, the answer is No.

One first gets into the starting point by going forward. Then a person goes backward 3 steps onwards. One goes back forward 1 step and then go back. So, the answer is No.

Steps forward can be repeated 3 times as many times as needed. If you take 13 steps forward, you are 4 steps from the starting point. In order to revert back to the starting point, you would have to take 13 - 4 = 5 steps forward. If you took 4 steps forward, you are 4 steps from the starting point. In order to revert back to the starting point, you would have to take 4 - 2 = 3 steps backwards. So, the answer is Yes.

Once you are in position one (forward), if you make the following steps, you always return to your position. If you make the following steps, take 6 steps backward, then take 8 steps backward, then take 4 steps backward, then take 4 steps backward, then take 3 steps left. So, the answer is Yes.

Turn 180 degrees counterclockwise, and take 7 steps left. A person who never faces forward always walks right. A person who never faces left always walks backward. Taking 7 steps left is more than 6 steps. So, the answer is yes.

Backward takes you straight and forward takes you left. Takes you 3 steps backward and 5 steps forward. Take 1 step forward and 3 steps right. It is the same thing as 1 step forward and backward. Not the same thing. So, the answer is No.

Face forward, as you make your way back to the starting point after each step. If you are facing backward, you have a clear path to take before looking up and taking 6 steps right. If you are facing down, you have a clear path to take before looking down and taking 9 steps left. If you are facing forward, you have a clear path to take before looking up and taking 5 steps left. So, the answer is No.

There are 5 steps forward and you cannot go backwards at this time. You need 8 to go backwards and 10 forward and 7 to go right. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 7 steps backward. Take 10 steps right. Take 4 steps forward. Take 1 step left. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

Always face forward in a forward direction. Take 5 steps backwards. Take 7 steps right to move you 3 steps forward. Take 4 steps forward, so you are now facing left. Take 1 step left and you are now facing right. So, the answer is Yes.
